featured.text: Moderate fires will clear the ground of competing plant life, and the rising heat dries and opens the ripe cones of the redwood, releasing many thousands of seeds onto the ground below.
A hundred million years ago, in the age of dinosaurs, redwoods were common in the forests of a much more moist and tropical North America.
While most other types of trees are destroyed by forest fires, the giant redwood actually prospers because of them.
The trunk of redwood trees is very stout and usually forms a single straight column.

other.text: It makes redwood trees more beautiful and appealing.
Why were redwood trees more prominent in the forests of North America millions of years ago? (A)
It allows redwood trees to bear seeds.
This fire resistant quality explains why the giant redwood grows to live that long.
Why do redwood trees grow to live that long according to the passage? (A)

definition.zh_def: 紅木是一種高大的常綠樹，主要生長在北美，特別是加利福尼亞州，以其耐久性和美麗的木材而聞名。
definition.en_def: A redwood is a tall evergreen tree native to North America, especially California, known for its durability and beautiful wood.
definition.example: The redwood trees in the national park are some of the tallest living things on Earth.
